authorize.title: Authorize.net
authorize.payment_account_validation_mode_info: This controls what type of validation is performed when a payment account is stored using CIM. 'None' performs no additional validation. 'Test' issues a test transaction that does not appear on the customer's statement but will generate an email to the merchant. 'Live' processes a $0.00 or $0.01 transaction that is immediately voided. Consult your Merchant Account Provider before setting this value to 'Live' as you may be subject to fees.
authorize.test_mode_info: The test mode feature is only supported by AIM. To test CIM transactions you must enable test mode from within your Authorize.net account.
authorize.developer_mode_info: Enabling this option will post transactions to the Authorize.net developer environment. You must have a developer test account in order to use this environment.
authorize.confirm_delete: You will not be able to recover this authorize.
authorize.list_of_authorize: This section will contain the list of authorize.

authorize.year_maxLength: Year should not be greater than 2 digits.
authorize.cvv_maxLength: CCV should not be greater than 4 digits.
authorize.cc_number_maxLength: Card number should not be greater than 19 digits.
